incidents.name: Login Irregularities in US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body:
Between 19:33 UTC and 19:42 UTC on February 28th, some customers in the US and EU regions may have experienced difficulties logging into the New Relic platform.

We resolved this service interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.

UI : US - AWS Lambda Integration : US

incident_updates.body: Customers may be seeing recovery of login services as of 19:42 UTC. We are continuing to monitor for a full recovery.

incidents.name: Login Irregularities in US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body: From 14:43 UTC to 15:06 UTC on February 21st, customers in the US and EU regions may have been unable to login to the New Relic platform. Services that rely on user credentials may have experienced irregularities. We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alert Irregularities for Workflows and Destinations in the US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 06:09 UTC and 9:45 UTC on February 17th, some customers in the US region may have experienced issues with alert notifications via workflows and destinations as well as latency and errors with the Alerts UI. Alerts sent through alert notification channels were working as expected. 

We investigated and resolved this issue and impacted services have returned to normal operation.
We are seeing recovery for impacted services.
We have implemented a fix for this issue and are monitoring for stability of alert notifications for workflows and destinations and the Alerts UI.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. 

Some customers in the US region using workflows and destinations may not be receiving alert notifications as expected. Additionally, customers in the US region may experience latency and irregular responses from the Alerts UI. Alert notifications sent via alert notification channels are working as expected.
We have identified the issue and are investigating opportunities to mitigate impact for affected customers.

Some customers in the US region using workflows and destinations may not be receiving alert notifications as expected. Affected customers may be unable to create or edit related alert policies. 

We are investigating this issue and will provide an update shortly.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Data Delays for the US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 22:13 UTC and 23:00 UTC, some customers in the US region may have experienced issues viewing and querying live-edge data. Alert notifications related to affected data may have been impacted. 

We investigated and resolved this issue. Services have returned to normal operation.
Some customers in the US region may be experiencing issues viewing and querying live-edge data. Alert notifications may be impacted for the affected customers.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Synthetics Alerts, Dashboard UI Irregularities for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 09:31 and 10:13 UTC, some customers experienced Synthetics logging failure and lag in Dashboards. Notifications were impacted for some customers between 09:31  and 10:13 UTC.

Weve resolved the issue with UI and/or alertsforProduct(s)in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.

We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

incidents.name: Logs in the Distributed tracing UI Delays for EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 06:14 UTC and 09:05 UTCUTC, some customers experienced logging synthetics for distributed tracing alerts failing. Data will not be recovered.
Weve resolved the issue with alertsforSynthetics, logs, APM Metrics, and Distributed tracing alertsin the EUregion. Services have returned to their normal operation.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alert and Data Ingest Latency in EU Region

incident_updates.body: From approximately 20:30 UTC to 21:19 UTC on January 26th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed data ingest and delayed and/or missing alert notifications. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of falsely triggered positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers during this period. We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incident_updates.body: From approximately 17:00 UTC to 18:37 UTC on January 24th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed data ingest and delayed and/or missing alert notifications. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of falsely triggered positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers from 17:49 UTC to 18:37 UTC. We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Logs and Alerts UI Irregularities in the EU Region

incident_updates.body: Between 13:28 UTC and 15:52 UTC on January 23rd, some customers in the EU regions may have been unable to navigate to the Logs UI and the Alerts UI. We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate an issue where some customers in the EU region may be unable to navigate to the Logs and Alerts UI's.
We are investigating an issue where some customers in the EU region may be unable to navigate to the Logs UI

incidents.name: Alerts and Synthetics alerts delays in US Region

incident_updates.body:
At the time of this interruption, we updated our status page out of an abundance of caution. After further investigation, we have determined alert notifications and synthetics were not impacted; however, some customers in the US region may have experienced brief and intermittent irregularities when viewing the classic Alerts UI. 

We identified and resolved this interruption and all services were returned to normal operation at 07:37 UTC on January 16th, 2023.
Weve resolved the issue with alerts lagforAlerts and Syntheticsin the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.
We have identified the issue with alertsforAlerts and Syntheticsin the US region. Delay in data lag is impacted for some customers. Were working to resolve it.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Some customers are experiencing an issue with alerts for Alerts & Synthetics in the US region. We will update this page as we resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Alerts & AI UI Navigation Errors

incident_updates.body:
Between 17:08 UTC and 18:30 UTC on January 13th, some customers in the US and EU regions may have been unable to navigate to the Alerts & UI page via the left hand navigation pane.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.
We are investigating an issue where some customers in the US and EU regions may be unable to navigate to the Alerts & AI UI via the left hand navigation pane.

incidents.name: Alert Notification Channel Irregularities in US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body:
Between 03:49 UTC and 09:43 UTC on January 13th, some customers using classic alerting features in the US and EU regions may have experienced relationships between alert notifications and alert notification channels not working as expected. Alert notifications may have been missing or delayed for impacted accounts.

Customers using the new Workflows and Destinations product for alert notifications were not impacted.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified the issue with alert notifications in the US and EU regions. Notifications are impacted for some customers. Were working to resolve it.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: All Products UI and Alerts Irregularities for US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body:
Between 8:30 UTC and 08:52 UTC on January 12th, some customers in the US and EU regions may have experienced latency in data ingest and missing and/or delayed alert notifications for related data. Data will not be recovered.
We identified a service interruption with an upstream cloud provider which has since been resolved and services have returned to normal operation.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incident_updates.body:

Weve resolved the issue with alerts for all products in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.
Some customers are experiencing an issue with Alerts in the US region. We will update this page as we resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Infrastructure On-Host Integrations irregularities for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between January 9th - 18:29 UTC and January 10th - 11:50 UTC, some customers experienced missing custom attributes across some Infrastructure On-Host Integrations. Data will not be recovered.

Weve resolved the issue with UI and alerts for Infrastructure On-Host Integrations in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.

incidents.name: UI Irregularities in the EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 19:13 UTC and 22:30 UTC on January 3rd, some customers in the EU region may have experienced issues logging into the New Relic platform and viewing some UI elements due to lost connectivity between New Relic and a cloud service provider.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work to restore network connectivity between New Relic and a cloud service provider. We are seeing recovery for some affected services and will be providing an update once system stability has been ensured. Meanwhile, some customers in the EU region may still be experiencing issues with login or viewing some UI elements.

incidents.name: Synthetics Alerts Delays for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 4:37 UTC December 18, 2022 and 6:30, some customers experienced delays in Synthetics Alerts.

Weve resolved the issue with alerts for Synthetics in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.
We have identified the issue with alerts for the Synthetics product in the US region. Notifications are impacted for some customers. Were working to resolve it.

incidents.name: Delayed billing data in the US

incident_updates.body:
Between 00:21 UTC and 01:24 UTC on December 17, some customers in the US region may have experienced Delayed billing data.
We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Trace Data Ingest Latency in EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 20:30 UTC, December 15th and 00:04 UTC, December 16th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delays for distributed trace data.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Trace API : Europe

incident_updates.body: We are seeing signs of service recovery as we continue to investigate an issue that may impact distributed trace data ingest for some customers in the EU region. We will continue to provide updates here as we work to resolve this interruption.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Trace API : Europe

incident_updates.body: Some customers in the EU region may be experiencing delays for distributed trace data. We are investigating and will provide more information as it becomes available. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Trace API : Europe

incidents.name: Alert Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body: From December 12th to December 13th, some customers in the US region may have experienced alert notifications remaining open even after the triggering violation(s) were closed.  We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Synthetics data delays for the EU Region

incident_updates.body: Between 12:30 UTC and 14:47 UTC, some customers may have experienced delays in Synthetics checks and related alert notifications. Weve resolved the issue with Synthetics in the EU region and services have returned to their normal operation.
Some customers in the EU region may be experiencing delays for results from Synthetics checks and alerting related to Synthetics. We will update this page as we work to resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Alert Delays in EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 22:26 UTC and 22:54 UTC on December 8th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed and/or missing alert notifications. 

We have resolved the issue with alert notifications for customers in the EU region and services have returned to normal operation.

Between 22:26 UTC and 22:54 UTC on December 8th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed and/or missing alert notifications. 

To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of falsely triggered positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 22:46 UTC and 22:54 UTC. We've identified and corrected the source of alert latency and services have returned to their normal operation. We are continuing to monitor to validate a full recovery.
Some customers in the EU region may be experiencing delayed and/or missing alert notifications. We are investigating and will provide updates on this page as they become available.

incidents.name: Synthetics Private Location Errors in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 19:00 UTC and 23:17 UTC on December 6th, some customers in the US region may have experienced errors when viewing, creating, or editing private synthetics locations and when editing or creating synthetics monitors.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: UI Irregularities in EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 17:53 UTC and 18:24 UTC on December 6th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced degraded UI performance, such as UI elements and charts failing to load.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Data Ingest Irregularities in the US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 19:32 UTC and 20:57 UTC on December 5th, some customers in the US region may have experienced latency in data ingest and missing and/or delayed alert notifications for related data. We've identified a service interruption with an upstream cloud provider which has since been resolved and services have returned to normal operation.
